headline.main: Obama Looks to History for Economic Message
headline.print_headline: In His Emphasis on Economy, Obama Is Looking to History

byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY and JIM RUTENBERG
byline.contributor: Adam Nagourney reported from Washington, and Jim Rutenberg from New York.

docs.lead_paragraph: Barack Obama is learning from predecessors as he seeks to shape public attitudes about the economic downturn.
docs.snippet: Barack Obama is learning from predecessors as he seeks to shape public attitudes about the economic downturn....

headline.main: Stimulus Bill Would Bestow New Aid to Many Workers

docs.lead_paragraph: Many part-time, low-income and female workers who have lost their jobs stand to benefit from the federal stimulus bill. Under the legislation, approved by Congress on Friday, not only would workers who already receive unemployment benefits get some additional money in their checks, but also many workers who have fallen through the cracks could soon be brought into the system. About 500,000 more people could become eligible for benefits, according to the National Employment Law Project.
docs.snippet: Many part-time, low-income and female workers who have lost their jobs stand to benefit from the federal stimulus bill....

headline.main: Obama Commutes 209 Prison Sentences, Issues 64 Pardons
headline.print_headline: Obama Commutes 209 Prison Sentences, Issues 64 Pardons

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama shortened the sentences of 209 prisoners and pardoned 64 individuals on Tuesday, the White House said.

headline.main: A Library for Obama First Needs an Address
headline.print_headline: A Library for Obama First Needs an Address

keywords.value: Bush, George W, Presidential Library and Museum
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: Pres Obama's supporters kick off the Barack H Obama Foundation, administration-blessed organization to find the money and address for an eventual Obama library; foundation is led by Marty Nesbitt, Chicago investor and Obama friend, along with businessman J Kevin Poorman and fund-raiser Julianna Smoot.
docs.lead_paragraph: A foundation is in place to begin the effort to create a presidential library with Barack Obama’s name on it. Where it will be built remains unclear.
docs.snippet: A foundation is in place to begin the effort to create a presidential library with Barack Obama’s name on it. Where it will be built remains unclear....

headline.main: AP FACT CHECK: Were Hands of Obama-Era Border Agents Tied?
headline.print_headline: AP FACT CHECK: Were Hands of Obama-Era Border Agents Tied?

docs.lead_paragraph: Assertions from the White House that immigration-enforcement agents had their hands tied in the last administration are difficult to square with the massive deportations of Barack Obama's presidency.
docs.snippet: Assertions from the White House that immigration-enforcement agents had their hands tied in the last administration are difficult to square with the massive deportations of Barack Obama's presidency....

headline.main: Obama Speaks on Israel, Trump in Last White House Interview
headline.print_headline: Obama Speaks on Israel, Trump in Last White House Interview

docs.lead_paragraph: The increase of Israeli settlements has "gotten so substantial" that it is inhibiting the possibility for an "effective, contiguous Palestinian state," President Barack Obama said Sunday, in his final interview as president.
docs.snippet: The increase of Israeli settlements has "gotten so substantial" that it is inhibiting the possibility for an "effective, contiguous Palestinian state," President Barack Obama said Sunday, in his final interview as president....

headline.main: Obama Prepares for a Busy Retirement, More Freedom
headline.print_headline: Obama Prepares for a Busy Retirement, More Freedom

docs.lead_paragraph: For Barack Obama, there's a presidential library to build, hundreds of millions of dollars to raise, causes to champion and a book to write. And don't forget that long-promised vacation with his wife.

headline.main: Obama, in Major National Security Speech, Defends Counterterrorism Legacy
headline.print_headline: Obama, Defending Legacy, Warns Against ‘Elevating’ Terrorists

byline.original: By GARDINER HARRIS and CHARLIE SAVAGE
byline.contributor: Gardiner Harris reported from Tampa, and Charlie Savage from Washington.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Speaking at MacDill Air Force Base, President Obama defended his approach to fighting wars while thwarting terrorist plots and protecting civil liberties.
docs.snippet: Speaking at MacDill Air Force Base, President Obama defended his approach to fighting wars while thwarting terrorist plots and protecting civil liberties....

headline.main: Obama Issues Warning on 1st Anniversary of Iran Nuclear Deal
headline.print_headline: Obama Issues Warning on 1st Anniversary of Iran Nuclear Deal

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama is marking the first anniversary of the Iran nuclear deal by warning the Trump administration that the accord can't easily be undone and is preferable to war.
docs.snippet: President Barack Obama is marking the first anniversary of the Iran nuclear deal by warning the Trump administration that the accord can't easily be undone and is preferable to war....
